ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] lvl 20?
ygData.msgSnippet: Your right.  But you can pull to the back yard behind the house, just make sure the puller goes slow so the mobs dont get lost and you wont get trained much
ygData.messageBody:
Your right. But you can pull to the back yard behind the house, just make
sure the puller goes slow so the mobs dont get "lost" and you wont get
trained much if at all if you pull to back yard.

Mu

The Ghost room should never get trained, blood pool only if ghost bails and
pit only if blood or ghost bails. Pretty safe actually. Just beware of the
hags, I still get hit for near full dmg with 150+ MR at lvl 55. Just
doesn't seem right. I can resist Krups and Ils in Sebilis but not the damn
hags.


-----Original Message-----
From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
Sent: Sunday, June 17, 2001 10:18 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] lvl 20?



Well, I meant like if you are inside a room and someone pulls a train that
passes thru your room without warning.
My mom was trying to get to lvl 20 in unrest and nearly lost lvl 19 bc she
died there so much.
luv,
-Su

> The stuff in that zone isnt really very nasty, with the exception of the
> hags. The problem is people dont take the time to learn the pathing in
that
> zone. The pathing doesn't do what you think it would but once you figure
it
> out it can be a very nice zone for exp.
>
> If you are pulling from the front of the house pull from the right side,
as
> you face it, and pull each room all the way around the bottom floor
counter
> clockwise leaving the middle room, the one with the stairs, for last. The
> Bar and Knight rooms are connected and the mobs can hit you through the
> floor so make sure you have another group in one of the rooms or have a
good
> group. The pit is great experience as well for mid 20's. The Ghost room,
> which use to have a list 10 people long at least on the weekends during
> prime time, is not camped much at all anymore and that is good exp for
lvls
> 28 to 33/34 or so.
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> Sent: Sunday, June 17, 2001 9:37 AM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] lvl 20?
>
>
>
> And if you can't get wolf form, you better hope that someone can cast
Invis
> vs undead. Stuff in this zone is very nasty.
> I went there at lvl 20.
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Once you get wolf form try Unrest. You can do well here. Wolf form is
> > neutral faction to the stuff here and you can pull solo rather well.
> >
> > Mu
